segments.text: Ugh, that overflowing sink is disgusting; water everywhere like a filthy flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor looks so gross, probably breeding germs already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the woman's foot in it—nasty, she needs to move before it's worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked; imagine the mold that'll grow there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those kids rummaging in the cookie jar—hands all over, who knows if they're clean.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's tilting in that mess; one wrong move and splat into the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching too, probably dropping crumbs everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole kitchen is turning into a sloppy disaster zone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the pretty garden outside can't hide the interior filth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing food stolen like that; it's just tacky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone clean this up before it gets even more revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dish towel she's using might end up wet and dirty too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yuck, the thought of slipping in that makes my skin crawl.
segments.speaker: PAR
